content.description:
THEROOTYTOOKUS  (Lower) 5.9- ** (140') M (9b)

- Pitch 1 is fun, sustained climbing with lots of variety. Begin 15' left (w) of BATTLE OF THE BURGE, left of the large fir. Climb the reddish corner (gear protected crux at start) for 20' then continue up and slightly right on sharp incut holds to the smoother upper face, and a belay ledge below the large Ponderosa (2 bolt anchor). Several large, medium and small cams and/or nuts (#3, 2, 1 and .5 camalots) needed at the start and final sections. (Chain anchors located 15' west of the large pine on top for the single rope rappel down MERCY STREET.)

(It is possible to continue up the upper face. To continue on, scramble up the loose scree to the base of the upper wall)

P2  5.9 * (110') M (9b)

- From the base of the upper wall (just right of the short corner), follow the bolted line left of center to belay at the large ledge below the short gnarled fir. Some medium and small cams needed.

P3  5.8 * (110') M (7b)

- From the ledge mount the lip (#3 cam needed below), and continue up the easier face (small cam needed), to turn the upper overhanging flakes on the right side (cool loose, wedged hand hold). Traverse left above, to belay just below the top (and the ominous pile of boulders).
content.protection: Mixed - several large, medium and small cams and/or nuts (#3, 2, 1 and .5 camalots) needed at the start and final sections.
content.location: Starts at the base of Middle Earth (4th route from left) at the first large corner from the left (left of the large fir tree at the base), and continues up the upper wall for the final 2 pitches.

content.description:
THERE AND BACK AGAIN  5.7 * (160) M(9b)

Climbs the face 15 left of THEROOTYTOOKUS. Lower section is mostly bolted, middle is broken and ledgy, and the upper section offers the best climbing and needs an assortment of gear to protect (small to large nuts or cams). Ends at the 2 chain rap anchor 15 west of the Ponderosa on top. For a single 60m rope, rap down MERCY STREET on the Middle Earth Wall.

SLEDGEHAMMER 5.10b *** 100’ F (10b)

Begin as for THE DARK END OF THE STREET and after the first bolt angle right and up to the set of chains over top (just left of the huge dying fir tree on top). Sustained, interesting and varied climbing through out.

"I've kicked the habit

shed my skin

this is the new stuff

I go dancing in…" (PG)
content.protection: fixed - 10 bolts to chain anchor over the top
content.location: At the left side of Middle Earth Wall in the new open space left by the massive rock fall.

content.description: Begin around to the right at the far right end of the cliff and climb across to the upper arete as soon as possible, ascend the arete to the more broken face and gully above.

MERCY STREET  5.6 ** (90') F(10b)

Sustained climbing on the face 50' left (west) of BATTLE OF THE BURGE, directly below the large roof and fir tree. Start in the large obvious crack (crux). Move left onto the face when possible and climb interesting moves on good rock to the pair of cold shuts at the top of the face right of the tree. Longer draws are recommended to reduce rope drag on upper section.

climbs.name: The Dark End of the Street

content.description:
THE DARK END OF THE STREET 5.11a *** (110') M(11b)

Climbs the face left of MERCY STREET, angling left of the huge overhanging inverted triangle. Three distinct cruxes make for a variety of (progressively harder) moves  crimpers, jugs, slopers are all here. Eases off for the top gear protected cracks (medium to small nuts). Cold shuts on top. Possible to lower with a 60m rope.
content.protection: mixed (med. to small nuts needed for the easier top)
content.location: 1st route on the left end of Middle Earth.

content.description: Excellent rock and climbing up the face just right of the 2nd corner to the large ledge on top. Possible to stop halfway up and lower off on a single rope.
content.protection: fixed, although gear can be placed in the lower corner.
content.location: directly above the approach trail, just left of the huge corner roof system.
